text: thank you agriculture is the main source of livelihood for 95 percent of the rural households in Lao PDR almost 80 percent of this cropped area is dedicated to growing rice rice is life for the people of Laos who have been planting and nurturing their rice fields for hundreds of years but the land doesn't always give back what this farmers put in and with a country whose birth rate is the highest in the region at 2.5 percent increasing rice production to feed their country is a high priority in the southern province of Savannah cat Farmers fields are continually at the mercy of drought and flooding unknown to some there is a field here which has been privy to a specially bred Lao modern variety or lmv rice plant s Village is just one of the many communities which have been part of the Lao Erie research and training project a partnership between the Lao PDR Ministry of Agriculture and Forestry and the international rice Research Institute or Erie this collaborative project was established in 1990 to assist the government of Lao PDR to achieve their National goal of rice self-sufficiency on a sustainable basis and for more than a decade of this 15-year partnership with Erie the Lao people have been celebrating rice self-sufficiency and um for Laos rice makes up 70 of their daily calorie requirements when loud people speak of achieving food self-sufficiency they mean having enough rice to eat a new technology for the right production is based on the new varieties new acronym aspect and also increasing the year the feedback from the farm are very important because we we keep the sea to the family after that we we get the information from them from 1997 the the first variety and the farmer grow this variety and get the high yielding injections foreign over the course of the project 18 new varieties were released they have been so successful that three-quarters of the households using Lao modern varieties were self-sufficient or had a surplus in rice while 64 percent of the farmers planting traditional varieties were rice deficient these are high yielding moderate duration rice varieties which have Eerie parentage these rice varieties would not be there today if it were not for the training and the assistance of the lawyeri project major achievement is here in this Jin Bank we keep 13 193 uh varieties we have to preserve this for the sustainable used by the researcher and Farmers to train people to identify and characterize those accessions and to use them in a breeding program below Eerie project has also supported the establishment of a training center out at the agricultural Research Center at a village called Nepal I think the training is very useful I have learned English writing report how to collect rice for research in the cold room the main thing before going further to disseminate our technology to the farmer first we train our participants we train our staff is foreign National right self-sufficiency since 1999. the rice sufficiency of the poor is estimated to be only 6.8 months in a year foreign foreign environment of Laos Farmers rice fields slope across the faces of the Mountainside creating more challenges for researchers and the farming communities thank you
